TestDescription.name: Apache version up to 1.3.33 htpasswd local overflow

WASPDescription.DetailsFormat: The script has been tested with these parameter values : ${combinations}

TestDescription.Description: [coolbox][dark]This alert was generated using only banner information. It may be a false positive. [/dark][/coolbox][break]A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in the htpasswd utility included with Apache. The vulnerability is due to improper bounds checking when copying user-supplied 'user' data into local buffers. [break][break][navy]Affected Apache versions (up to 1.3.33).[/navy][break]
TestDescription.Impact: Since the program is not setuid, this vulnerability does not have a local impact. However, this may be an issue if the software is called from a CGI script. An attacker may be able to supply malformed data to the program which will cause the overflow to occur.
TestDescription.Recommendation: Make sure htpasswd does not run setuid and is not accessible through any CGI scripts.

Reference.database: FlowSecurity.org: Local Stack Overflow on htpasswd apache 1.3.31 advisory
